course.title: Qualitative Research in Education
course.description: What can qualitative approaches to research add to our understanding of education, in an era where 'data' are often equated with numbers? In this course, we will examine qualitative methods as a complement and counterpoint to mainstream paradigms in education research. Students will design and implement a small pilot study on an education topic of choice. We will investigate the process of research design, including question formulation, selecting appropriate tools for data collection, and strategies for analyses. The work will be informed by critical reading and discussion of empirical and theoretical scholarship on the intersection of culture, community, and education.
